page.title: 14CONSTANTINE ECOLOGY
page.content: {CLIMATE}AND WEATHER.The Constantine area has mild winters with not much snow or heavy frosts.We have an early spring and sheltered valleys,so the area is known for early crops and bulbs.We have long warm summers, although cloud often gathers spasmodically during the day and there are frequent showery days.Constantine often has different weather conditions to surrounding areas, e.g local mist especially in the morning and evening The high places in this area catch the east winds but prevailing wind is south westerly.ANIMALS,foxes breed alot in this areaand hunting is very popular.Rabbits are plentiful so there is much shooting which helps keep them down. Badgers,are often seen and tip over our bins looking for food.Bats appear in the summer at twilight and dive across the lanes.Frogs are found
